question: Last night I couldn't sleep for a little over 4 hours, whenver I laid down my left ear began pulsating uncontrollably.  I checked my pulse on the side of my neck, and it was definitely going at the same rate.  It sounded like a moving train by my left ear.  When I sat up, after about 30 seconds it stopped,  A few nights ago, when I lied down my feet began to tingle and then became a "sandy feeling," which occurs only when I am usually in an uncomfortable position for a long time.  I had trouble moving my feet, since the sandy feeling became worse.  I used to have this problem when I worked at Famous Footwear on the floor for 4 hours or more without a break, but my whole leg would go numb.  I rationalzied that I had bad circulation (this used to occur about 4 years ago.)  Right now as I type this my left foot won't stop pulsating on the pad of my foot, and its been like that for a few hours.  I have always had terrible circulation....When I was younger I used to complain about "gas" in my tummy, but the doctors claimed I was fine.  I had regular check ups every year, but when I was 12 my doctor said she heard an irregular heart beat.  I went to have an ultrasound and they determined the whole wall of my heart was missing, and now my heart is larger then it should be (one side is.)  Could this be a side effect of that?I ended up having open heart surgery when I was 12 since I was diagnosed with an ASD (Atrial Septal Defect, and the hole was over 2 cm long.)Can someone tell me why the pulsating will not stop.  Recentely at night my feet twich a lot.  And I cannot control the twiches.  My toes and feet appear to spaz out and it wakes me up.  What is this???
title: Pulsating Body
